Articles.Content:
This is what my space station look like atm:

The problem is I don't know what to do the the far end of the station. Does anyone have any good ideas?

I'd like for it to at least my thematically useful, however I don't want to hold crew as there is no passage though the station from the to get to it.

I dont like over using mods, but i don't mind installing them if there gonna be useful and and in-keeping with the stock theme. I already use mods like mechjeb and deadly re-entry ect.

Thanks in advance for any help / advice.

Nick

Could think of a section for docking craft .... I would think of adding a section of structural fuselage with in line clamp-o-trons spaced apart and facing in alternating directions ... unfortunately it would of been better to use a Snr. docking port to connect the docking 'array' as it will take some stress as ships dock to it.

None the less, a docking 'array' away from your solar panels and if possible in such a manner the ports dont turn as the station orbits, is a logical step.

Could also add a small dedicated craft for getting to the planet, and then a craft for doing tugboat work (taking payloads off lifters and then docking them to the station).

A Communications array would also be a natural addition (not that the game needs it to work, just a role playing consideration).

EDIT: Oh yeah, how is that thing lit ? Can you dock with it in the dark side ? Some lights may be useful on the docking array.
Power module, crew module, HUB (4way), docking ring, escape pod(s), comm tower, science module, storage module.

Somewhere to dock SSTOs only and extend the area for docking capsules.

Maybe you could make a comms area with some antennas and stuff like that, just for looks

Make a big circle out of girders, then put docking ports all the way around it, along the lines of this:

Unless I am mistaken, those are the medium size girders that he puts on one end and holds shift to bend it a fixed amount...then puts another at the end of that one and bends that one point repeat till you have a circle.

How did you "bend" those girders?

Hold shift and use WASDQE to rotate them in small increments.

Definitly a docking hub where ships can dock and refuel.

I'd say another docking hub for fuel tanks, but you already have fuel tanks as structural part of the station, so that won't be to important

Here's mine. There's a big ol' orange fuel tank where the senior docking port is, and the ship that's in the dock is orbiting Dres right now. Otherwise it's the same. The solar panel end is made so that I can continue adding power modules to the end. The center hub has two more docking ports besides the senior. The arms on the dock end have lights. It pretty much floods whatever is in the bay. I was going to try to make long arms that extend length-wise along whatever is in the bay, but they proved impossible to dock, so I opted for this. I may revisit it by making the hub have junior ports on the ends of them, so I can plug arms into them. I dunno if it's worth the effort, though.

I've redesigned this thing four times now.

Edited July 1, 2013 by DChurchill
